conbody.p: Eucalyptus provides the ability to create point-in-time snapshots of volumes. Each snapshot of a volume is assigned a unique ID in the format snap-<nnnnnnnn>, where <nnnnnnnn> is a hexadecimal number.Depending on the application, you might have manually flush pending data writes cached in memory to the volume before creating a snapshot. This helps to ensure application data consistency in the snapshot.

Snapshots are created on the Node Controller, but are automatically transferred to, and cached on, the Storage Controller. From the Storage Controller they are transferred to the Walrus. On the Walrus, snapshots are persistently stored at /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/snap-<nnnnnnnn>.
